snippet: Three jurors from the John Edwards trial said on television that they believed him guilty of at least one charge but that the government had not proven its case.
abstract: Three jurors from the trial of John Edwards say in interviews on morning television programs that they believe he was guilty of at least one of the campaign-finance charges against him, but that the government failed to prove its case.
lead_paragraph: Three jurors from the John Edwards trial said on television that they believed him guilty of at least one charge but that the government had not proven its case.

headline.seo: Some Edwards Jurors Believed Him Guilty on at Least One Charge
headline.main: Edwards Jurors Open Up in Morning TV Interviews
headline.print_headline: Edwards Jurors Open Up In Morning TV Interviews
